title: Classic Hollywood Leading Ladies
description: How well do you remember the silver screen's most iconic actresses? Test your knowledge of Audrey, Marilyn, and more!

questions.question: Which actress starred as Holly Golightly in the 1961 classic 'Breakfast at Tiffany's'?
questions.explanation: Audrey Hepburn's portrayal of Holly Golightly is one of the most iconic roles in cinema history.

questions.question: Elizabeth Taylor was the first actress to be paid $1 million for a single role. Which 1963 film was it?
options: Cat on a Hot Tin Roof
questions.explanation: Taylor received a record-breaking $1 million to play the title role in the epic 'Cleopatra'.

questions.question: Marilyn Monroe famously sang 'Diamonds Are a Girl's Best Friend' in which film?
questions.explanation: The iconic musical number takes place in the 1953 film 'Gentlemen Prefer Blondes'.

questions.question: Which leading lady left Hollywood in 1956 to become the Princess of Monaco?
questions.explanation: Grace Kelly retired from acting at age 26 to marry Prince Rainier III of Monaco.

questions.question: Judy Garland is most famous for her role as Dorothy Gale in which 1939 film?
questions.explanation: Judy Garland became an international superstar playing Dorothy in 'The Wizard of Oz'.
